interactions.userMessage: let's try to make circles highlighting text in the blog articles bigger, also with larger text, and occupying a little part of the text space, so moving the a bit towards the center of the page
interactions.responseSummary: Let me look at the current circle highlighting implementation.

interactions.userMessage: a bit more towards the center, with larger text, and I want space between the circle and the main body text
interactions.responseSummary: Let me re-read the current state to make precise edits.

interactions.userMessage: You misunderstood me. I want the circle to overlap the main body text, but I want the main body text to go around them so that it is still fully readable
interactions.responseSummary: Got it — you want the circles to intrude into the text column but have the text **wrap around** them. That requires using CSS `float` + `shape-outside: circle()` instead of absolute positioning. Th...

interactions.userMessage: make the circles a bit bigger. Do not put them exactly at the same location of corresponding text, otherwise it seems redoundant
interactions.responseSummary: I need to offset the circles so they appear a few paragraphs before the quoted text, and make them bigger. Let me update both the insertion logic and the CSS.

interactions.userMessage: put the circle at exactly one third of the page or corresponding side
interactions.responseSummary: The circle is 380px wide. To place it so exactly 1/3 of the container width is inside the text area, the outer margin needs to be `calc(100% / 3 - 380px)`. When the container is 700px, that's `233p...

interactions.userMessage: increase the vertical spacing between circles and surrounding text
interactions.responseSummary: Added `margin-top: 2.5rem` and increased `margin-bottom` from `1rem` to `2.5rem` on both sides, giving the circles more breathing room above and below.
Shifted from 1/3 to 1/4 — now only 175px (one quarter of 700px) overlaps the text, with 205px extending outside. The circles sit noticeably more outward while still intruding into the text flow.

interactions.userMessage: I see. The problem is that I want the wrapping text to follow the curve of the circle. Now the effect is like the circles are surrounded by squares
interactions.responseSummary: The issue is that `shape-outside: circle(50%)` defaults to the `margin-box` as reference, and with the large negative margins the margin box is no longer square — so the circle shape gets distorted...

interactions.userMessage: better, centre back circles at 1/3 of the page of either side. Make the text inside larger, not the circle
interactions.responseSummary: Circles back to 1/3 positioning and text bumped from 0.88rem to 1rem.

interactions.userMessage: circles should not be very far from their original sources. Maximum one extra paragraph of distance
interactions.responseSummary: Changed from 3 to 1 — each circle now appears just one paragraph before its source text.
